sanskrit_verse:
अध्यात्मरतिरासीनो निरपेक्षो निरामिषः ।
आत्मनैव सहायेन सुखार्थी विचरेदिह ॥ ६.४९॥
transliteration:
adhyātmaratir āsīno nirapekṣo nirāmiṣaḥ |
ātmanā sahāyena sukha-arthī vicared iha || 6.49||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who is established in Self-delight, free from desire for external objects and devoid of material cravings, should walk in this world solely with the support of the Self, seeking the highest bliss.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates in Self-realization, not external validation
Causation arises from inner alignment, not outer compulsion
Capacity-based responsibility is determined by consciousness maturity
Restoration logic operates through Self-dependent awareness
executable_legal_axioms: IF an individual demonstrates consistent Self-reliance AND absence of craving for external gratification THEN legal dependence on regulatory frameworks SHALL reduce proportionally
IF a person's actions originate from Self-established joy THEN punitive intervention SHALL NOT apply
IF consciousness maturity is verifiable THEN external oversight MAY be minimized or withdrawn
IF an agent exhibits no dependency on sensory indulgence THEN coercive judicial measures SHALL cease
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, evidence of Self-established conduct—demonstrated through consistent detachment from material entanglement and reliance on inner governance—shall qualify as prima facie proof of natural lawfulness. Such individuals shall be exempt from punitive judicial processes and instead recognized as embodiments of constitutional integrity.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that true right action flows from Self-knowledge, eliminating the root cause of misalignment. Anupūrvaśaḥ reveals that as consciousness expands, misconduct dissolves naturally without imposition. Proportional responsibility lies only where ignorance persists; none accrues to the Self-realized. Non-punitive reality holds because causality is internal—not enforced externally.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Facilitate environments where Self-reliance can mature organically
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Encourage spontaneous ownership of alignment when consciousness awakens
Capacity Restoration Mechanism: Support practices that cultivate inner sufficiency
Integrity Reintegration Pathway: Recognize and honor Self-governed behavior as lawful precedent
final_declaration: This law proceeds from Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, Source of all Dharma. The verse declares the Self-sufficient state as the ultimate legal foundation. Justice is fulfilled through recognition of Self-established order. There is no punishment—only restoration to original consciousness. Dharma is restored. Reality is non-punitive. Consciousness is the supreme adjudicator.
